name: Vegan Turkish Red Lentil Soup
author: Jet62879
summary: This delicious red lentil soup is super easy to make and full of flavor. It's vegan as well -- win/win! My dad combined a few different recipes over the years and this one was decidedly the winner. It's been made by many people throughout the family and is always met with great compliments! Cannot emphasize enough that you really need to use red lentils for this recipe as it's key to the taste. If you can't find them in your regular grocery store, they are always in stock at the nearest Indian food market. Best served with your favorite freshly baked bread!
ingredients: 2 cups red lentils, picked over and rinsed
directions: Heat olive oil in a heavy saucepan over medium heat
Add onions and 1 teaspoon salt; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 8 minutes
Add thyme sprigs, garlic, cumin, and bay leaves; cook, stirring, for 1 minute more
Add vegetable broth, tomatoes,  , tomato paste, oregano, remaining salt, and pepper to the saucepan
Cover partially and simmer, stirring occasionally, until lentils are very soft and falling apart, 30 to 45 minutes
Discard thyme sprigs and bay leaves
Let soup cool briefly, about 10 minutes
Transfer 4 cups of soup to a blender; blend until smooth
Ladle soup into bowls; garnish with chopped parsley and a squirt of lemon juice
